category: line of fire, vehicle incident general
text: a driver was reversing his mini bus as close to the shelter made contact with scaffold pole. a driver was positioning his mini bus, pa 7954g, close to the tankage rest shelter near ss t28. there was heavy rain at the time, and he wanted to position his vehicle as close to the shelter as possible so personnel he was picking up would not get wet when entering the mini bus. as he was reversing parallel to the shelter exit the rear of his vehicle made contact with scaffold pole that was part of a structure for the lighting protection system. the scaffold pole is not part of the main shelter structure and the only damage that was noted was a small indentation on the rear bodywork of the mini bus. there were no passengers in the bus at the time and no persons in line of fire as he was maneuvering close to the shelter. the driver was taken to crisp village for interview by em and wood safety managers. after interview it was decided there was no requirement to carry out a&d screening. scaffold supervisor reinspect the scaffold pole and there is no damage; only damage to the end cap.  initiated investigation process

individual heard that a member of his bubble had covid-19 symptoms and immediately left the workplace.  a family member had symptoms and subsequently tested positive for covid-19. the employee also had a covid-19 test and tested positive.  individual left the workplace to home to isolate until a test was taken. the individual will now self isolate for 10 days. his indoor workplace was cleaned.

category: fall from or working at height issue, slips & trips
text: during vessel b301-unit 100 cleaning operation while ip descending ladder , ip slipped on wet rung and fell on his side. migrated from legacy cairs incident #31485normal 0 21 false false false fr x-none x-none microsoftinternetexplorer4 incident circumstances :relating to hse representative version during vessel b301-unit 100 cleaning operation while ip descending ladder ,this later fall down on his back from 1.5 m height.ip was evacuated to sonatrach medical center and after was evacuated to skikda hospital for medical exams in presence of hse representative.ip x-ray did not mention fractures or something serious and ip returned onsite.it appears that the cause of the incident was the ladder steps which were slippery and wet with the cleaning water of the cleaning operation.incident investigation ongoing .*****************************************************************************************************************************************detailed discreptions updated:normal 0 21 false false false fr x-none x-none microsoftinternetexplorer4 during investigation we spoke with ip to have more details about incident , we asked him about circumstances and if height was 1.5 m , ip replied that when he came down in the vessel by the ladder arrived at 1 m height (and not 1.5 m) he slipped because ladder steps were wet because of the cleaning task and after slipped he held the ladder and at 80 cm height then letting go the ladder to choosing to fell on his side, thinking this was the safest thing to do. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

ee felt an irritation in his left eye.  while climbing up the interior scaffold of the cyclone, ee's hand brushed a shelf as he was climbing up, causing debris to fall into his face.   ee then felt irritation in his left eye  ee attempted to perform self irrigation of left eye, reported irritation to supervision, supervisor performed eye irrigation, ee returned to work. after lunch, ee's left eye was showing signs of irritation, supervisor sent ee to off site medical clinic for further evaluation.clinic performed evaluation, diagnosis of corneal abrasion without foreign body, antibiotic eye drops were prescribed, and ee was given a full medical release without restrictions.

moxy travelling from wpa to area 700 suffered a hydraulic failure resulting in a loss of approximately 1l of hydraulic fluid to soil.  moxy travelling from wpa to area 700 suffered a hydraulic failure resulting in a loss of approximately 1l of hydraulic fluid to soil. contaminated soil removed for disposal. mechanics to inspect the machine and repair.  contaminated soil removed for disposal. mechanics to inspect the machine and repair.

while conducting boring operations to install conduit for an electrical line, drill came in contact with a buried electrical line, while conducting boring operations to install conduit for an electrical line the tip of the pilot drill came in contact with a buried electrical line. az811 had been called but the line w ultraas unmarked. the existing buried electrical line was damaged to an as yet unknown extent and power was lost to residents in the area for a period of minutes.  reporting initiated.

wood employee tested positive for covid-19 wood employee tested positive for covid-19, via pcr test. this is understood to be a community transmission.  individual entered self isolation period, as per government requirements

employee received positive covid-19 test results employee was tested for covid as part of a medical exam related to other issues.  employee received confirmation of positive test results. contact tracing is underway.

gpa activated - flame detection on ap cellar deck migrated from legacy cairs incident #33774gpa activated at 1433 on 02/05/17 – flame indication on ap platform cellar deck.the ftl plus 1 investigated and reported that the cellar deck was clear. he was then assisted by an instrument tech at the ap ccr where they identified uv 4602 (wemco’s) was activated. initial investigation revealed that the under-deck welding party had activated the uv. the following overrides were in place on ssic 000158:-wellhead area 1801 and 1802ppd hut 1001/1002em gen module 0801/0802diesel area 0901/0902general area 0101 and 0102on investigation no direct line of sight path from the welding area to the activated uv was found as the ap cellar deck is solid deck area. it is therefore highly likely that the activation was triggered indirectly from the welding arc by means of reflection from some source, possibly the sea or some reflective metallic object. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

wood worker was in monitoring pre-embark to ppm-1 at the hotel. he performed the covid-19 test on december 8th and the result was positive. wood worker was in monitoring pre-embark to ppm-1 at the hotel. he performed the covid-19 test on december 8th and the result was positive. the ip is asymptomatic.  the ip is asymptomatic. he received guidance from the nursing technician regarding the necessary care and will be sent to home for quarantine period.

it contractor allowed on site without approval. security noticed reception letting someone into the building via side glass door. security queried this with reception and was told that it was an it contractor who had been 'given approval' by a colleague. security checked with hsse and local it who both confirmed that they were unaware of the visit. local it related that the ip had been booked to replace a battery on a laptop but did not inform anyone. hsse arranged completion of the necessary information to ensure the ip was formally allowed into the office.

ip’s groin was groped causing him pain. two workers undertaking cable pulling activities, one worker spoke to another to state he was leaving the area for another workplace, during some horseplay the ip’s groin was groped causing him pain. this resulted in medical treatment - injection. worker was assessed by afw medic and blng medics.worker was taken to sungai liang clinic by blng ambulance and transferred over to kb hospital as a precaution.

an employee was changing into rubber boots and when he put his right foot in the boot he felt pain on the side of his foot.  a staple was found in the boot which caused an abrasion. migrated from legacy cairs incident #30844on wednesday, july 13, 2016 at 10:30 am at the oc-600 block of dow freeport an infinity construction employee was changing into rubber boots. when he put his right foot in the boot he felt pain on the side of his foot. a staple was found in the boot which caused an abrasion. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

third-party bore contractor made contact with underground utility causing coating damage during reaming process. no release of product. migrated from legacy cairs incident #38352we were notified today by third-party contractor that contact was made with the coating of a 6” underground pipeline during boring operations. no release of product. wood. third-party bore subcontractor completed the first two stages of drilling and pulling their reamer on 07/10/18 at approx. 5:55pm. they were tasked to bore north/south under highway 56 near berthoud, co. bore subcontractor set up their rig on the southwest intersection of hwy. 56 and cr 7. they sent their pilot drill north under hwy 56 and pulled back with their 20” reamer. the following day, 07/11/18, at approx. 09:00am ebc pulled 12" tke future pipeline south through their bore under hwy. 7 with wood.'s assistance. as bore subcontractor began to bore southeast of highway 56 and cr 7, when damaged utility owner line locator stopped at the location and mentioned that bore subcontractor was crossing underneath their line. operations were immediately stopped as third-party hydrovac mobilized to location to verify depth and separations of the two lines. both lines were exposed southeast of hwy. 56 and cr 7 revealing that there was approx. 12-15” of separation between the newly bored 12” tke line and the pre-existing underground utility line. hydrovac mobilized northwest of hwy. 56 and cr 7 to verify the line separation between pre-existing line and tke line. hydrovac revealed that there was approx. 3” of separation between the two lines. at approx. 4:00pm further investigation revealed that coating contact was made when bore subcontractor reamed their initial pilot hole the day before. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

employee hit a pile with his bucket while digging ee was digging next to a pile when he swung his bucket and made contact with the pile.  operator stopped work and alerted his supervisor. company policy will be followed.

category: bites (animals or insects), general injury, general illness or health issue
text: mechanical worker sustained a bee sting to the back of neck. on tuesday, july 20,2021 at approximately 2:00 pm, a mechanical worker was working in block-4 when they felt a sting to the back of his neck. the insect was observed and verified as a bee. the actual severity rating is a1 as the mechanical worker received a medical evaluation only, no first aid was provided. the potential severity rating is a b2 as the situation could have required medical treatment had there been an allergic reaction to the sting. the mechanical worker informed their supervisor, who escorted them to the on-site medic for evaluation. medical evaluation only was provided as no further treatment was needed. a call with work care stated that an evaluation was adequate due to no allergic reaction and minimal swelling. a follow-up will be held tomorrow with the team member.

wood team member tested positive for covid-19 while working from home a wood team member experienced mild signs and symptoms associated with covid 19 and was seen and tested by a primary health care provider. the employee received a positive test result.  team member, reported to hssesome recommendations were sent to the employee by hsse

no injury recorded, minor vehicle damage only. mechanical tradesperson hit the swipe access box upon entering site at ewan maddock dam in work vehicle. migrated from legacy cairs incident #34656no injury recorded, minor vehicle damage only. mechanical tradesperson hit the swipe access box upon entering site at ewan maddock dam in work vehicle.relevant information:1. the staff members front right bumper was slightly damaged. 2. the vehicle was an izuzu dmax - registration 336wsu. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: foot or leg injury, slips & trips
text: ip tripped and fell while collecting daily readings from the mound, resulting in swollen ankle. ee was walking down a mound of dirt. ee slipped on the tarp lining rolling the ankle one way while the body went the other. ee reports they slid down a hill that was 15 feet before the end of the slide and also landed on the r hip. workcare contacted, internal reporting initiated.

wood truck 01200036 was damaged in a hit and run accident a wood employee was driving a wood ford truck tx lp. fmy 8637 south on beltway 8 @ 225 traveling to clute.   a white chevy truck driven by an unknown person swerved into the lane the wood employee was in and collided with the passenger side mirror.  the white chevy sped up and did not stop for the accident.  the wood driver was not able to obtain a license plate number of the other vehicle.the actual/potential decision is based on damage to property being minor less then $10,000. employee reported event to his supervisor and safety department.

wood employee resulted covid19 positive after rt-pcr test reference to the bcp activated last january 14th 2021 at the shallow water platform due to a spex contractor who tested positive after demobilising. a wood employee turned out to be positive after the pcr test conducted to them yesterday at the hotel where they where taken for quarantine. lert is now activated.  local emergency response is now activated. ip01 is now being closely monitored by wood oh team. ip is currently staying at a client designated quarantine facility which will later be transferred by wood to another quarantine facility which will accept (+) cases.

category: weather related issue, vehicle incident general
text: a staff was driving a seqwater vehicle and reversed into a member of the publics vehicle at the bellbowrie shopping plaza 30mar17 1030est. incident was reported to supervisor at the time. delayed entering due to severe weather event seq. migrated from legacy cairs incident #33593a staff was driving a seqwater vehicle and reversed into a member of the publics vehicle at the bellbowrie shopping plaza 30mar17 1030est.relevant information:1. staff member backed into a holden cruze registration 759 sse.2. no vehicle damaged occurred on the seqwater vehicle and minor damage on the holden cruze vehicle.3. seqwater registration 369 wsu.4. staff member was unable to locate owner of the vehicle and left contact details on the windscreen.5. staff member did not sustain any injuries. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

excavator leaned on its right side when attempting to straddle a trench. the civil crew was preparing to work at psc skid 30 to clean up the trench in order for the electrical department to run the mv and fiber optic cable to the psc skid. at about 7:00am the excavator operator attempted to track the equipment over the trench to place the equipment in a straddle position. the operator tracked the excavator in the direction southwest at an angle over the trench. when the right track made contact with the ground soil on the opposite side of the trench, the soil settled in a form to cause the excavator to lean on its right side. incident is still under investigation and any additional findings will be submitted in the rca along with corrective actions. excavator has been placed on level ground without further incident.

the wood employee was tested offshore and show positive result for covid.  the wood employee was tested offshore and show positive result for covid. he is asymptomatic. isolation and disembark by sanevac.

fitter went on an angle iron, and the angle iron hit the leg when the fitter who worked in area p12 went through a narrow passage between the switchboard and the cableway (in the same area), he walked on a protruding angle iron. the sharp edge of the angle iron hit the fitter on the right leg, which led to pain and immediate swelling of the leg. the fitter consulted the medic the same day (monday) for a check-up, and painkillers were prescribed. after the third day (wednesday) with painkillers, the fitter went home at his own request. after returning home, a gp was consulted for a further check-up. no damage was detected beyond the swelling of the leg, but it was recommended to take it easy in the near future. ip reports that his foot is doing well and that he expects to travel as planned at the next mobilization.the incident occurred under work management from equinor, the fitter was hired out to operate for work at the pa plant. - nurse was consulted for a check-up / treatment. no fractures or cuts were detected, but painkillers such as ibux and panodil were given due to swelling and pain in the lower right leg.- covered protruding angle irons with foam rubber and marked them with clearly visible tape.- registered and classified the incident in equinor's hse database synergi.- the incident was reviewed with mobilized personnel.

pain in arm during scaffold destruct when removing long term scaffolding fittings from a beam using a long spanner, the ip when pulling down on  the fitting felt a sudden pain to his right arm as the nut on the fitting released. the ip continued to work the rest of the shift. no immediate action taken as the ip continued to work the rest of his shift. the ip went to the clair ridge medic the following morning prior to shift start.

wgis operative wrongly blasted pipe work marked as a 'red area' migrated from legacy cairs incident #30688wgis were under instruction from the client to grit blast and paint pipework and header boxes.the process requires wgis management / supervision to be instructed on the specific task by the client through issue of a painting / preparation report (io32). theclient will identify and highlight areas which have to be blasted via a colour coding which is physically marked on the pipework within the location. the code consists of red, orange and white paint applied by the inspection team: •red : areas not to be blasted.•orange : risk assessment to be issued by client prior to blasting. low pressure blasting only on these areas.•white : areas to be blasted.wgis blasting operatives wrongly blasted pipework marked as a red area. the pipework involved was a pressurized line containing ethanol.the blasting operatives were under instruction from their supervisor to blast all pipework.no injuries were sustained when this activity wascarried out. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

no injury sustained. client appointed contractor (limpet) carrying out trial of new technology climb assist system. operator observed damage to the retracting safety line, trial was stopped, retracting safety line quarantined. migrated from legacy cairs incident #33952client appointed contractor (limpet) was carrying out a trial of new technology climb assist system on the sea access ladder of the transition piece at levenmouth development turbine. the limpet operator observed damage to the retracting safety line, the trial was stopped, equipment was quarantined pending further investigation by limpet. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

confirmed positive for covid-19 employee tested positive for covid when being tested for a personal procedure.   contact tracing was conducted and is being reviewed by hsse.  employee received two negative tests since september 14th positive.

other fall to lower level less than 6 feet an employee was using a two-step step stool to reach a high shelf when she fell and struck her knee on the stool. she broke her left knee and was hospitalized for surgery.

struck by discharged object or substance an employee was sandblasting when the hose became disconnected. as he attempted to fix the hose, his right arm was sandblasted. the sandblaster was running at the time.

exposure to environmental heat at 3:00 p.m. on july 29, 2021, an employee developed heat-related illness while driving a package delivery car. the illness caused the employee to get into an accident, and the employee was hospitalized.

category: foot or leg injury, dropped object or material, back injury, lifting or moving loads
text: struck by falling object or equipment, n.e.c. an employee was rigging a crane with a panel. when the crane lifted the panel off the floor, another panel that was next to it fell on the employee, who suffered a broken leg and back fracture.

category: hand or arm injury, fall from or working at height issue
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee was working off an 8-foot step ladder, standing on the sixth step. as he started to descend the ladder, the ladder shifted and he lost his balance and fell to the floor. he landed on his left wrist, causing a severe fracture. he was hospitalized for surgery.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee at a poppet machine had just finished putting a box together, but the box was not spinning correctly. when she opened the interlocked door to balance the box, the chuck pulled in her right glove and then twisted her right index finger, partially amputating it.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was running a machine when one of the rings would not enter the roller correctly. as the employee attempted to steady the ring, his glove became caught between the two rollers, causing his hand to be pulled into the machine. his left pinky finger was avulsed and amputated to at the first knuckle.

category: fall from or working at height issue
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee on travel status fell over a railing to the floor below while waiting for a flight and suffered multiple fractures.

category: foot or leg injury, slips & trips
text: fall on same level due to slipping  an employee was pushing a cart when he slipped on spilled liquid soap, fracturing his left ankle. he was hospitalized.
exposure to environmental heat a temporary employee had been shoveling sand and collapsed onto the floor of the foundry. he was hospitalized for heat stroke.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was loading cars and looking for packages left behind. as he reached into the running equipment his right arm was caught in the pulley and belt, fracturing it. the equipment was not guarded at the time.
fall on same level due to slipping  an employee was exiting a roll-on/roll-off ship. while walking down the side ramp he slipped and fell, landing on the steel ramp surface an breaking his left hip.
nonclassifiable an employee was using a gasoline powered backpack blower when he started swaying and collapsed, requiring hospitalization.

category: hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: fall on same level due to slipping  after exiting her car, an employee slipped on the ice in the employer's parking lot while walking to the hospital and broke her arm.  she was hospitalized.
inhalation of harmful substance-single episode two employees were cutting concrete with a power saw when they were overcome by carbon monoxide poisoning.

contact with hot objects or substances on 8/19/2020, at 6:20 a.m., an employee was performing routine cleaning on a reclaim pelletizer. while performing this task, the employee attempted to activate the dump valve that stores hot water. due to an internal defect on the pipe valve, the hot water did not drain out completely. as the employee released the locking collar, the stored water released through the gap, spraying hot water onto the employee. the employee sustained first and second degree thermal burns to the chest and left arm.

direct exposure to electricity, greater than 220 volts on 9/15/2017, at approximately 3:10 p.m., two employees were in an articulating boom lift raising up along the side of a grain bin when they contacted overhead powerlines, receiving electrical shocks.

caught in running equipment or machinery, unspecified an employee was removing/loosening webbed material from a rotating roller when the employee's left index finger was caught in the material, causing an amputation to the first knuckle.

category: dropped object or material, foot or leg injury, lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general
text: struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part in a cleanout area at a plant, an employee was cleaning out the tailgate of a dump truck that was tilted up. a piece of asphalt in the dump body of the truck broke free, falling and striking the employee in the right leg, ankle, and foot. the employee suffered five broken toes and a broken ankle, as well as a laceration on the right leg requiring stitches, and was hospitalized.

category: foot or leg injury, lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general
text: struck by object or equipment, unspecified an employee was helping a forklift operator erect a 30-foot-tall frame when the employee lost control of the frame and it struck the employee's knee, breaking it in two places. the employee was hospitalized and had surgery.

category: lifting or moving loads, line strike, hand or arm injury, head or face injury, dropped object or material, slips & trips
text:
struck by falling object or equipment, n.e.c. a temporary employee was manually removing steel rings from production equipment when the steel rings slipped. the employee tried to catch the rings as they fell and suffered a severe laceration on his right hand requiring hospitalization. 

an employee was repairing a dock door and replacing the panel when the cable and the panel popped back and struck him in the face. the employee was hospitalized for a fractured jaw.

note to user: this record contains two separate events that were reported simultaneously to osha by the employer.  these events are captured as one report.
injured by slipping or swinging object held by injured worker an employee was using a wrench to loosen a nut. the wrench slipped resulting in the amputation of the left thumb tip.

caught in or compressed by equipment or objects, unspecified an employee was changing out a hydraulic cylinder when his finger was pinched between the cylinder and the base, causing a partial fingertip amputation.

category: foot or leg injury, lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general
text: pedestrian struck by vehicle in nonroadway area, unspecified an employee was working in the aisle stocking items when a forklift was leaving the receiving department.  the forklift hit the employee in the stock aisle and pinned them against the shelving unit. the employee sustained a broken ankle and a ruptured liver.

struck by object or equipment, unspecified an employee was delimbing a cut-down tree. one of the limbs kicked back and struck the employee between the ankle and the knee, breaking the employee's tibia.

category: foot or leg injury, slips & trips
text: other fall to lower level less than 6 feet while walking down steps, an employee fell down two steps to the floor and suffered a broken femur. the employee was hospitalized.
fall onto or against object on same level, n.e.c. an employee ran into a fixed desk and fell to the floor. the employee's hip was injured by the fall and required surgery.

fall on same level while climbing stairs, steps, or curbs an employee was meeting a prospective client with her sales manager at the prospective client's residence. upon entering the home, the employee missed a step on the stairs leading to the foyer and fell, fracturing her right hip and requiring surgery.

category: line strike, hand or arm injury
text: struck by discharged object or substance an employee was removing a hydraulic line from a piece on an excavator. the line was still pressurized and when the connection was broken, the line crossed his left hand, injecting hydraulic oil into the hand and causing a laceration. he was hospitalized.

text: other fall to lower level, unspecified on or about 04/29/2015, an employee was hospitalized when she fell down the outside steps and landed face down, injuring her head and experiencing tingling and numbness.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was feeding a panel saw and holding the boards to be cut. the employee's left thumb was pinched between the pressure beam of the saw and the stack of wood, resulting in a fingertip amputation.

category: dropped object or material, lifting or moving loads, hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: struck by falling object or equipment, n.e.c. on june 8, 2017, an employee was holding one side of a manhole cover while a coworker lifted the manhole cover with a crowbar on the opposite side. the manhole cover slipped off of the crowbar hook and fell onto the employee's hand, pinching off the finger pads of his right middle and ring fingers between the manhole lid and lip. his ring fingertip had to be surgically amputated.
overexertion in lifting-single episode an employee was lifting a laundry bag when she felt severe back pain and was hospitalized.
bending, crawling, reaching, twisting-single episode an employee was bending over to open a box with a knife and his back popped resulting in a herniated disc.

text: struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part a drill stem fell onto an employee's leg as it was being lifted by a crane. the employee sustained a broken leg.

category: hand or arm injury, fall from or working at height issue
text: contact with objects and equipment, n.e.c. an employee began to fall from a ladder when he reached out to grab a metal stud. his fingers got caught in a hole in the metal stud, resulting in amputation of two of his fingertips.
fall on same level, n.e.c.  an employee was loading a box when it fell back, causing the employee to lose balance and fall. the employee suffered a broken rib and punctured lung.

text: pedestrian struck by vehicle in nonroadway area, unspecified an employee was in a walkway and was struck by the rear of a forklift that was making a left-hand turn. the employee was hospitalized for a hip injury.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee working on a production line in the parbake plant amputated three fingertips on his left hand while trying to unjam equipment.
fall on same level due to tripping over an object  an employee tripped over a pallet and fell on a concrete surface, suffering a fractured hip that required hospitalization.

injury by other person-unintentional or intent unknown, n.e.c. an employee was injured while talking a resident down from a ladder. the individual had secured a butter knife to remove the cover off of a light bulb. the employee was slashed in the eye by the butter knife and required surgery.

struck or run over by rolling powered vehicle an employee was on a walkie rider and approaching another walkie rider. the employee stepped off before the unit came to a complete stop and a foot was caught between the two units resulting in a broken ankle.

text: jack-knifed or overturned, nonroadway on september 19, 2015, at approximately 3:45pm, an equipment operator was hospitalized after suffering fractured vertebrae in his neck and back, a broken left arm, and broken ribs.  the employee was operating a morooca tracked dump truck on an access road hauling water when the track slipped off the road and the vehicle rolled over an embankment.
jack-knifed or overturned, nonroadway an employee was test driving the company utility vehicle. the vehicle turned onto its side and the employee sustained a fractured left leg.

exposure to environmental heat an employee was working on the roof bringing down materials to the ground floor. afterwards, he went to the tent area to take a break and was abnormally fatigued, requiring hospitalization for dehydration and a muscle injury.
hitting, kicking, beating, shoving an inmate punched an employee in the face multiple times, causing facial swelling and a concussion.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was attempting to unjam a piece of cereal packing equipment when the equipment cycled and crushed the employee's right index fingertip, resulting in a fingertip amputation. the machine was guarded at the time of the incident.

struck against moving part of machinery or equipment an employee was performing a rip cut on a table saw and amputated two fingers on the right hand. the saw was guarded at the time.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was attempting to remove a stub of core at a core cutter when his hand went between the ejector and roller, and his middle finger became caught. his fingertip was pulled off between the equipment.

category: dropped object or material, foot or leg injury
text: struck by falling object or equipment, unspecified a wall fell while being taken down. it struck an employee in the back of the leg, causing a laceration.

category: dropped object or material, foot or leg injury, slips & trips
text: struck by falling object or equipment, unspecified an employee was drilling holes in c-channel beams that were 16 feet long and weighed approximately 400 pounds. the employee placed three beams on saw horses. after drilling holes, he manually flipped them over. when the employee flipped the third beam it landed at an angle and fell off the saw horses and struck and fractured the employee's right leg and left ankle. the employee was hospitalized for surgery on his left ankle.
